newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT - Pioneer cut to neutral.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT - Pioneer cut to neutral.

text.p: Dain Bosworth analyst Bonnie Wittenburg said Friday she downgraded agricultural company Pioneer Hi-Bred International Inc to neutral from buy on price.

-- On Thursday, DuPont Co and Pioneer announced an agreement to form a joint venture. In addition, DuPont agreed to buy 20 percent of Pioneer, or roughly 16 million shares, in a $1.7 billion deal. Pioneer also announced it would buy back about 16 million shares in a dutch auction.
-- Pioneer shares were unchanged on Friday after closing up 13-7/16 at 90 on Thursday.

-- "The key question is where does Pioneer's stock price settle in after the Dutch auction, and we tend to think that it settles in somewhere between $85-$95," Wittenburg said in a report. "Thus, our downgrade to neutral from buy."
-- She said she applauds the Pioneer-DuPont deal strategically but does not see an earnings per share impact for Pioneer from the joint venture for at least three years.
